config.question: How did colonists react to the imposition of the Stamp Act?

choices.content: Colonists shunned imported items on which Parliament had placed a tax.
The courts refused to reopen, and most newspapers decided not to publish until Parliament repealed the Stamp Act.
Each year the American colonists exported more consumer goods like cloth, metal goods, and ceramics than they bought.
Stamp distributors in almost every American port publicly resigned, and without distributors, the hated revenue stamps could not be sold.

answer_3.response: Throughout the colonies, women altered styles of dress, made homespun cloth, and shunned imported items on which Parliament had placed a tax, which led to a serious reduction in the sale of British goods in America after the Stamp Act.
